result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant MICHAEL A FINNEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

-Any treatment as recommended by the Agent.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt: PLEA DIVERSION AGREEMENT - 24 months

ADDRESS INFO for Michael A Finney - Per Atty Roeth
Current: W7082 Gemini Way, Fond du Lac, WI 54937 United States  (Effective: 12-06-2016)
Prior: 307 Tassler St, Princeton, WI 54968

1:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2016CF42, with a PDA on count 1 and plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2016CM102.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CF42 and orders judgment of conviction be withheld pending compliance with the Plea diversion agreement.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2016CF42 and on counts 1 & 2 on 2016CM102.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF42 (Count 2) & 2016CM102 (count 1 & 2)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $73.32
-Any treatment as recommended by the Agent.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit on 2016CF42.

Court adjourned at 1:20 p.m.
Notice of hearing for plea & sentencing scheduled on 12/05/2016 at 9:00 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Moved, left no address.  Unable to Forward.  Return to sender.
Notice of hearing for plea & sentencing scheduled on 11/15/2016 at 11:30 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Moved, left no address.  Unable to Forward.  Return to sender.

Court adjourned at 9:19 a.m.

Defendant called to inform us that his ride's car won't start and he is not able to make court this morning, he lives in Fond du lac.  Defendant stated that he left a message for his attorney.

3:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary heairng.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 21, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 3:07 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
